2012-panel1.websiteName: Reducing Employee Health Care Costs: Beyond Cost Shifting
2012-panel1.description: Moderated by Regina E. Herzlinger, Nancy R. McPherson Professor of Business Administration at HBS, this panel focused on innovative product models, increased access to quality and cost information, and incentives to encourage healthy behaviors in employees.

2012-panel2.websiteName: Developing More Meaningful Drugs, Devices, and Diagnostics
2012-panel2.description: Led by William W. Chin, MD, Bertarelli Professor of Translational Medical Science and Professor of Medicine at HMS, this panel focused on new approaches to research and innovative business models, and how life science companies can be more patient centric.

2012-panel3.websiteName: Translating Academic Research into Clinical and Commercial Use
2012-panel3.description: Headed by Barbara J. McNeil, MD, Ridley Watts Professor of Health Care Policy at HMS, this panel explored novel financing mechanisms as well as opportunities for academia, foundations, and companies to share critical information.

2012-panel4.description: Moderated by Clayton M. Christensen, Kim B. Clark Professor of Business Administration at HBS, this panel discussed approaches to making care delivery more patient-friendly by providing services where and when people want them, organized in clear and efficient ways.

2012-panel5.websiteName: Improving the Value of Care Delivery
2012-panel5.description: Led by Michael E. Porter, Bishop William Lawrence University Professor at Harvard University, this panel discussed the critical role that high-quality, established health care providers can play in coordinating care for individuals as well as managing care for defined populations.

i_pass.name: I-Pass
i_pass.oneline: The I-PASS Handoff Process is a multifaceted approach to improve the exchange of information among health care providers.
i_pass.descriptionRaw: %%org%% uses a multifaceted approach to improve the exchange of information among health care providers by standardizing the patient hand-off process at every change of shift. It has already yielded a 30% reduction in medical errors resulting from patient transfer.  The enterprise is led by the I-Pass Executive Council, a group of six individuals from a number of hospitals across the country, including Boston Children’s/Harvard Medical School, St. Christopher’s Hospital for Children/Drexel University College of Medicine, and the Benioff Children’s Hospital/University of California San Francisco.
i_pass.descriptionPlain: I-Pass uses a multifaceted approach to improve the exchange of information among health care providers by standardizing the patient hand-off process at every change of shift. It has already yielded a 30% reduction in medical errors resulting from patient transfer.  The enterprise is led by the I-Pass Executive Council, a group of six individuals from a number of hospitals across the country, including Boston Children’s/Harvard Medical School, St. Christopher’s Hospital for Children/Drexel University College of Medicine, and the Benioff Children’s Hospital/University of California San Francisco.
i_pass.descriptionWithLinkHtml: I-Pass uses a multifaceted approach to improve the exchange of information among health care providers by standardizing the patient hand-off process at every change of shift. It has already yielded a 30% reduction in medical errors resulting from patient transfer. The enterprise is led by the I-Pass Executive Council, a group of six individuals from a number of hospitals across the country, including Boston Children’s/Harvard Medical School, St. Christopher’s Hospital for Children/Drexel University College of Medicine, and the Benioff Children’s Hospital/University of California San Francisco.

bloodbuy.name: Bloodbuy
bloodbuy.oneline: Bloodbuy connects hospitals and blood centers nationwide, to ensure the efficient flow of lifesaving blood products to patients in need.
bloodbuy.descriptionRaw: %%org%% notes that blood is a core commodity of health care. For this reason, the Dallas company built a cloud-based platform that addresses the uneven geographic distribution of available blood supply in real time, enabling price transparency and greater efficiency in a critical health care market.
bloodbuy.descriptionPlain: Bloodbuy notes that blood is a core commodity of health care. For this reason, the Dallas company built a cloud-based platform that addresses the uneven geographic distribution of available blood supply in real time, enabling price transparency and greater efficiency in a critical health care market.
bloodbuy.descriptionWithLinkHtml: Bloodbuy notes that blood is a core commodity of health care. For this reason, the Dallas company built a cloud-based platform that addresses the uneven geographic distribution of available blood supply in real time, enabling price transparency and greater efficiency in a critical health care market.

medalogix.name: Medalogix
medalogix.oneline: Medalogix improves a patient’s final days by leveraging data insights.
medalogix.descriptionRaw: The goal of %%org%% is to help provide better quality of life at the end of a patient’s life. The Nashville-based company does this by leveraging predictive analytics to identify patients that are eligible for hospice and then implementing a workflow that allows clinicians to help patients better manage the hospice decision and transfer process, minimizing associated difficulties and costs for all those involved.
medalogix.descriptionPlain: The goal of Medalogix is to help provide better quality of life at the end of a patient’s life. The Nashville-based company does this by leveraging predictive analytics to identify patients that are eligible for hospice and then implementing a workflow that allows clinicians to help patients better manage the hospice decision and transfer process, minimizing associated difficulties and costs for all those involved.
medalogix.descriptionWithLinkHtml: The goal of Medalogix is to help provide better quality of life at the end of a patient’s life. The Nashville-based company does this by leveraging predictive analytics to identify patients that are eligible for hospice and then implementing a workflow that allows clinicians to help patients better manage the hospice decision and transfer process, minimizing associated difficulties and costs for all those involved.

twine.name: Twine Health
twine.oneline: Twine is a cloud-based collaborative care platform that aligns patient and clinician values through the model of apprenticeship.
twine.descriptionRaw: %%org%% is a collaborative care app that allows patients and their doctors to co-create treatment plans for chronic disease, including access to motivational coaches and virtual support. The app’s efficacy has been proven over six years of research at the MIT Media Lab and is currently demonstrating markedly improved outcomes at one-third the cost of regular treatments.
twine.descriptionPlain: Twine Health is a collaborative care app that allows patients and their doctors to co-create treatment plans for chronic disease, including access to motivational coaches and virtual support. The app’s efficacy has been proven over six years of research at the MIT Media Lab and is currently demonstrating markedly improved outcomes at one-third the cost of regular treatments.
twine.descriptionWithLinkHtml: Twine Health is a collaborative care app that allows patients and their doctors to co-create treatment plans for chronic disease, including access to motivational coaches and virtual support. The app’s efficacy has been proven over six years of research at the MIT Media Lab and is currently demonstrating markedly improved outcomes at one-third the cost of regular treatments.

challenge-application-word-length.description: You will be asked to describe your solution, articulate how it improves health care value, quantify the potential impact it could have if disseminated broadly, and outline your dissemination plan in a ~1000 word application.

challenge-meta-description.val: Apply for The Health Acceleration Challenge. Bring proven innovation to US Health Care Delivery with the Harvard Forum on Health Care Innovation.

social-linkedin-share-source.description: length: 200 chars. The source of the article. Must be URL encoded. Example: Wired Magazine

social-linkedin-share-summary.val: Bloodbuy, I-Pass, Medalogix and Twine win the HBS-HMS Health Acceleration Challenge 2014! Thank you to the 478 applicants and 2,747 participants for sharing their demonstrated health care innovations that are ready to scale.
social-linkedin-share-summary.description: length: 256 chars. A brief summary of the article. Must be URL encoded. Longer titles will be truncated gracefully with ellipses.

social-linkedin-share-title.description: length: 200 chars. The title of the article. Must be URL encoded

social-twitter-share-tweet.val: Congrats to the HBS-HMS Health Acceleration Challenge Finalists! @IPASSHANDOFF @Bloodbuy @medalogix @twinehealth  http://forumonhealthcareinnovation.org/?utm_campaign=hac_announce&utm_source=fhi-web-selftweet&utm_medium=social&utm_content=tweet_2014-11-19_23-11_pm
